definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: There have only ever been 106 verified supercentenarians in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 在英国也只有106位已核实的超级百岁老人。

sentences.english: I'd never heard the word "supercentenarian" before I met one.
sentences.chinese: 我没见到那个人之前，还没听说过“超级百岁老人”。

sentences.english: All centenarians receive a card from the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 每位百岁老人都会收到女王寄来的贺卡。

sentences.english: So then Barzilai and his colleagues turned to the centenarians' children.
sentences.chinese: 所以巴茨莱和他的同事们转向了百岁老人的子女们。
那位百岁老人依然健在。

sentences.english: Tea is the beverage most commonly enjoyed by centenarians.
sentences.chinese: 茶是百岁老人所享用的最普遍的饮料。

definition: old man or woman/the elderly/one's aged parents or grandparents
Changshou suburban district of Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
a family bereaved of its only child
home of respect for aged/nursing home
god of longevity/elderly person whose birthday is being celebrated
person suffering (from a disease or poisoning)/a patient
(coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
